title: segfault in p2p stream handler while gracefully shutting down beacon chain
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description When turning off with a SIGINT, my beacon-chain segfaulted while shutting down. I was running with a lot of peers and it looks like it segfaulted in some p2p handler, but what do I know XD ### Has this worked before in a previous version? I have not seen this error before. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Beacon chain points to local geth node. `geth --goerli --rpc --port 30305 --rpcport 8555` `./prysm.sh beacon-chain --http-web3provider=http://localhost:8555 --p2p-max-peers 256` ## üî• Error
